case_title: Muhammad Abid Iqbal vs District Election Commissioner, etc.

connected_cases.title: Din Muhammad vs District Election Commissioner Kasur
Khalid Bashir vs District Election Commissioner Kasur
Khushi Muhammad vs Returning Officer, etc.
Muhammad Latif vs Returning Officer, etc.

legal_issue: Competency of Intra Court Appeals under proviso to sub-section (2) of section 3 of the Law Reforms Ordinance, 1972.
key_points: Nomination papers of appellants were rejected by Returning Officers on grounds such as proposer and seconder not being enrolled in the ward or proposer not being a registered voter.
Appeals before the Appellate Authority were dismissed.
Writ petitions filed before the High Court were also dismissed.

Intra Court Appeals were deemed incompetent as the law provided for one appeal against the original orders under Sub-rule (10) of Rule 14 of the Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013.

laws_referred.name: Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013

precedents_cited.case_title: Mst. Karim Baksh and others vs Hussain Bakhsh and another
Ahmad Raza and another vs Chief Election Commissioner, etc.
precedents_cited.citation: Unreported order dated 12.10.2015 in I.C.A. No.1305 of 2015

judgment_summary: The court dismissed the Intra Court Appeals, stating they were not competent as the applicable law provided for one appeal against the original orders. No order as to costs.
